images.caption: Wild garlic by the River Conon. A section of the Uig Woodland Walk by the Conon runs through a profusion of wild garlic. Wonderful aroma.

description: This walk takes you along the Uig Woodland trail on the Isle of Skye. The trail also leads into Glen Conon where there are some nice riverside paths and a waterfall to see. The walk starts next to the River Rha and the football pitch in the village. From here you can pick up a footpath heading east through the peaceful woodland with views to Uig Bay to the south. You can then cross the bridge over the Conon to enter the Conon Nature Reserve where there is a further footpath along the river leading to a waterfall. Along the way you can look out and listen for a variety of woodland birds and other wildlife. Just to the south you can extend your walk on the Fairy Glen Walk. It's a beautiful place with waterfalls and pretty pools surrounded by picturesque little hills. Just to the north there's also the lovely Falls Of Rha, another local scenic highlight.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: After your walk you could enjoy some rest and refreshment at the Ferry Inn. The 19th century Inn is in a lovely spot on the southwest-facing Uig Bay, with a glorious view towards the Waternish peninsula from the garden area. The inn includes a vibrant bar and a restaurant selling high quality dishes. You can find them at postcode IV51 9XP. The inn is dog friendly in the bar.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Head south east and you can visit the Island's capital at Portree. Here you can pick up the circular Portree Scorrybreac Walk and enjoy views of the picturesque harbour, the colourful buildings of Portree town and out to the Island of Raasay.
